intro: Hyoseris microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, serrated, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hyoseris microcephala is known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
